posts.post_content: [Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth ) makes all your zombies unblockable at no extra cost.
posts.html:
Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth makes all your zombies unblockable at no extra cost.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: justicarphaeton (12/13/2010 10:30:42 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: He's actually after all these years still playable in zombie decks. 2/3 for 3 is ok, swampwalk is nice, and the regeneration ability (even though it doesn't work for himself) is cheap as well. Not to mention that he is a zombie by now as well, and thus gets buffed by other zombie-buffing cards.
posts.html:
He's actually after all these years still playable in zombie decks. 2/3 for 3 is ok, swampwalk is nice, and the regeneration ability (even though it doesn't work for himself) is cheap as well. Not to mention that he is a zombie by now as well, and thus gets buffed by other zombie-buffing cards.

posts.post_content: @majinara: Don't forget that the Zombie Master isn't a Legend, meaning you can have two in play at the same time. Not only do you get the safety of redundancy, but your Masters can now regenerate.
posts.html:
@majinara: Don't forget that the Zombie Master isn't a Legend, meaning you can have two in play at the same time. Not only do you get the safety of redundancy, but your Masters can now regenerate.

Posted By: yyukichigai (6/30/2011 9:54:34 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: A 2/3 body Lord creature with 2 tribal abilities for 3 was very good in Alpha's time as far as black is concerned. With today's available Zombies, Zombie Master is beast, and a staple in most Zombie decks. I guess he was the standard used to design subsequent Zombie lords such as [Lord of the Undead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of the Undead) and [Death Baron](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death Baron).
posts.html:
A 2/3 body Lord creature with 2 tribal abilities for 3 was very good in Alpha's time as far as black is concerned. With today's available Zombies, Zombie Master is beast, and a staple in most Zombie decks. I guess he was the standard used to design subsequent Zombie lords such as Lord of the Undead and Death Baron.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Curious_Homarid (9/17/2011 6:28:13 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I remember when I first started playing magic. I wanted to play a Zombie deck. I found the gatherer and set the search for zombies only. Well after sifting all the zombie cards in the game. There were to many to affectivly make a deck. So I started to cut cards and after 10 or 12 protodecks this guy made the cut in every single one. He is now one of my go to zombie cards, the other is [Death Baron](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death Baron)
posts.html:

There were to many to affectivly make a deck. So I started to cut cards and after 10 or 12 protodecks this guy made the cut in every single one. He is now one of my go to zombie cards, the other is Death Baron

Posted By: ArmoredMercenary (10/11/2011 4:20:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This and [Death Baron](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death Baron) are a wicked combo. When playing against other zombies which didn't have a Zombie Master down, I waited, built up my forces, played this kinda like a sorcery and zerged my opponent for ~28 swampwalk for the win. Easily a staple for zombie decks.  
  
Don't forget to add a few [Evil Presence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evil Presence) or at least sideboard a few.
posts.html:

Don't forget to add a few Evil Presence or at least sideboard a few.
